textBeforeTable: A. General Education (6 SHC) Course Requirements for Barbering Diploma Program Site: West Harnett Center - Day Program, Evening Program Career Pathway Option: Diploma in Barbering Program Length: 4 semesters Academic Standards: See General Academic Standards. Entrance Standards: See General Admission Standards. The Barbering curriculum is designed to provide competency-based knowledge, scientific/artistic principles, and hands-on fundamentals associated with the barbering industry. The curriculum also provides a simulated environment that enables students to develop manipulative skills. Coursework includes instruction in all phases of professional barbering, hair design, chemical processes, skin care, nail care, multi-cultural practices, business / computer principles, product knowledge, and other selected topics. Graduates should qualify to sit for the State Board of Examiners. Upon successfully passing the State Board exam, graduates will be issued a license. Employment is available in barbershops and related businesses. Barbering Credential: Diploma in Barbering D55110 Public Service Technologies College Catalog 2008-2010 Table of Contents Money for College College Services Distance Education Continuing Education Programs of Study Admissions --> Webadvisor GroupWise Business Office Intranet Faculty & Staff
